title:
Existence and regularity of solutions for the elliptic nonlinear
  transparent media equation
authors:
Francesco Balducci, Francescantonio Oliva, Francesco Petitta, Matheus
  F. Stapenhorst
abstract:
In this paper we study existence and regularity of solutions to Dirichlet
problems as
  $$
  \begin{cases}
  - {\rm div}\left(|u|^m\frac{D u}{|D u|}\right) = f & \text{in}\;\Omega,\\
\newline
  u=0 & \text{on}\;\partial\Omega,
  \end{cases}
  $$
  where $\Omega$ is an open bounded subset of $\mathbb{R}^N$ ($N\geq 2$) with
Lipschitz boundary, $m>0$, and $f$ belongs to the Lorentz space
$L^{N,\infty}(\Omega)$. In particular, we explore the regularizing effect given
by the degenerate coefficient $|u|^m$ in order to get non-trivial and bounded
solutions with no smallness assumptions on the size of the data.
